title_full: SAAS06-BP01 Understand silo, pool, and bridge deployment models for resource efficiency
title: Understand silo, pool, and bridge deployment models for resource efficiency
description: Have a good understanding of the key value and principles behind silo, pool, and bridge deployment models, including awareness of how these strategies can be applied granularly across layers and services of your solution. Regulatory, competitive, strategic, cost efficiency, and market considerations influence architecture. These patterns can be applied in combinations to enable the most efficient consumption of infrastructure resources.

title_full: SAAS06-BP02 Understand operational tradeoffs of each deployment model
title: Understand operational tradeoffs of each deployment model
description: Understand the operational tradeoffs of silo, pool, and bridge models. Build a unified onboarding, operations, and analytics experience spanning any of these models. Have a complete end-to-end automated tenant onboarding process that maps tenancy models to resources provisioned at each architecture layer. Maintain detailed insights into footprint, consumption costs, and tradeoffs associated with each deployment model.

title_full: SAAS06-BP03 Use managed services to maintain optimal hardware utilization
title: Use managed services to maintain optimal hardware utilization
description: Use managed services to shift responsibility for maintaining optimal utilization of deployed hardware to AWS. SaaS by nature promotes sharing infrastructure across tenants to maximize efficiency and economies of scale. Continually evaluate opportunities to maximize infrastructure sharing for reduced energy consumption. Examples include Amazon RDS, AWS Fargate, Amazon Redshift, Amazon MSK, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon EKS.

title_full: SAAS06-BP04 Right-size compute resources and use auto-scaling based on utilization
title: Right-size compute resources and use auto-scaling based on utilization
description: Right-size compute resources based on your architecture and iteratively optimize by tracking utilization. Use auto-scaling to handle peak system load. Use AWS Compute Optimizer to analyze configuration and utilization metrics, report whether resources are optimal, and generate optimization recommendations. Use Amazon CloudWatch metrics to monitor performance including CPU utilization.

title_full: SAAS06-BP05 Use serverless computing to optimize resource utilization automatically
title: Use serverless computing to optimize resource utilization automatically
description: Use serverless computing and other managed services to automatically scale resources as needed, eliminate tasks for infrastructure provisioning and management, and optimize resource utilization automatically. Serverless on AWS helps build and run applications without thinking about servers, capacity sizing and provisioning, and maintenance. This aligns infrastructure consumption with actual tenant activity.

title_full: SAAS06-BP06 Maintain updated inventory of infrastructure resources per tenant
title: Maintain updated inventory of infrastructure resources per tenant
description: Keep an updated list of infrastructure resources allocated per tenant. Use AWS Systems Manager Inventory for visibility into your computing environment. Use AWS Config for detailed view of resource configuration including how resources are related and how they were configured over time. Use AWS Cost and Usage Reports with resource tags to find information about specific resources with user-defined cost allocation tags.

title_full: SAAS06-BP07 Maintain and test tenant off-boarding runbooks
title: Maintain and test tenant off-boarding runbooks
description: Maintain a runbook with steps required to off-board a tenant and periodically test it in non-production environments. When a tenant stops using the SaaS solution, decommission the tenant's footprint including infrastructure resources, compute, storage, and data when there is no expectation of reactivation. The faster unused resources can be decommissioned, the lower the impact, as decommissioned resources equate to energy saved. Describe this process as part of the SLA.

title_full: SAAS06-BP08 Automate tenant decommissioning with approval workflows
title: Automate tenant decommissioning with approval workflows
description: Use automation tools to run decommissioning steps to avoid human errors and speed up run time. Start automated decommissioning processes as part of a process approval system such as a ServiceNow-approved workflow. Use AWS Step Functions for serverless orchestration. The process should not affect performance of active tenants. Use auto-scaling to remove capacity as demand changes. Use AWS CloudFormation to delete entire stacks as a single unit.

title_full: SAAS06-BP09 Archive tenant data before decommissioning for compliance and reactivation
title: Archive tenant data before decommissioning for compliance and reactivation
description: Before decommissioning, ensure if required that a copy of tenant data is created to meet audit or compliance requirements and to restore or reactivate the tenant in the future. Use Amazon S3 storage classes including Amazon Glacier to store or archive tenant data for long-term retention with reduced energy consumption. Use Amazon S3 Inventory to list objects and their metadata on a daily or weekly basis.

title_full: SAAS06-BP10 Instrument per-tenant metrics for footprint visibility
title: Instrument per-tenant metrics for footprint visibility
description: Instrument your SaaS application to collect metrics at a per-tenant level to accurately capture activities and consumption patterns. Use application and system monitoring tools to identify infrastructure usage patterns on a per-tenant basis with data tied back to the tenant. Use Amazon CloudWatch and partner tools like DataDog or New Relic to capture and surface per-tenant metrics and consumption data.

title_full: SAAS06-BP11 Provide per-tenant footprint dashboards including carbon emission data
title: Provide per-tenant footprint dashboards including carbon emission data
description: Provide detailed dashboards and visualizations of per-tenant operational data across different SaaS solution layers. Include total compute required (CPU, memory usage), data transfer and network costs, and storage costs. Create a unified view of per-tenant footprint for useful operational insights. Use AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool to track, measure, review, and forecast carbon emissions from AWS usage. Reflecting consumption per tenant creates sustainability awareness and improvement processes.
